results.title: Getting around
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras explores the Public Transport system in Beijing. This is heavily used as cars are a rarity. Buses are in great demand and overcrowded. Trains are more modern and luxurious by comparison, while bicycles are by far the most common form of transport. This episode illustrates the vocabulary and protocols required to use the Public Transport system effectively. Presents a sequence looking at the history of the Chinese Language and the confusion which can arise when words sound the same but have different meaning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University

results.title: Night light
results.brief_description: A video clip made up of a series of photo stills taken of night lights. Images and the resonant, original soundtrack capture the intensity and variety of urban life.

results.title: School days
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
Professor Colin Mackerras visits a primary school in Beijing. Chinese schools follow a traditional curricula where the emphasis is on reading, writing and mathematics. Facilities are often simple and the teaching using the traditional “chalk and talk” method. Schools are responsible for teaching the importance of birth control and hygiene to students as well as giving them a moral and political education. Outside the classroom students play Chinese games such as “elastics”. The program also looks at the importance of radical characters in Chinese writing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University

results.title: Si Mamad (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Handojo Misc, Sjumandjaja, Lambang Film Teledan and Matari Film
results.brief_description: A poor, middle-aged Muslim archivist steals stationery from his office to support his family, only to find that the store to which he sells the stationery to is owned by his boss. He develops an obsessional guilt complex and compulsion to confess his dishonesty. A tragi-comedy, providing some incisive observations of the contemporary scene in Jakarta, in particular the gap between the rich and the poor. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Shyness
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Abnormal shyness in children, its causes and how, through a greater understanding by parents and teachers, this problem may be dealt with. The lonely existence of a typical shy adult is portrayed, and the film then turns to a study of three children: Anna, shy but wistfully wanting association with others; Jimmy, whose excessive timidity is really a symptom of profound emotional disturbance; Robert, aloof but happily independent. Studying their conditions, a psychiatrist from the Child Guidance Clinic reveals the confidence-destroying demands of parents which predisposed the children to shyness. Together, teacher, psychiartrist and parents bring about a change in the children’s attitides. (Awards: Cleveland; New York; Toronto; Boston; Manila.)

results.title: Impossible touch
results.brief_description: Effective use of experimental camerawork and editing adds complexity to a story of the hesitation and intensity of yearning. This work is an evocation of a shared imagining of what might be. An original soundtrack contributes a sense of journey within the relationship.
results.description: Effective use of experimental camerawork and editing adds complexity to a story of the hesitation and intensity of yearning. This work is an evocation of a shared imagining of what might be. An original soundtrack contributes a sense of journey within the relationship.

results.title: Entertainment
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras looks at recreational activities in China. Cinema going is particularly popular and European and American films are being shown more frequently. The Peking Opera is a much loved and traditional art form, steeped in cultural heritage. Although it is not as popular amongst young Chinese, tourists love the rich pageantry. The Chinese also love outdoor events in parks and on waterways. The composition of Chinese characters in Chinese writing is also examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University

results.title: Shrinkage
results.creator_credit: Nathan Boxer, Willard Goodman and Protective Films
results.brief_description: Shoplifting in a department store and how to deal with it. The methods used by shoplifters to distract attention and conceal stolen goods. Precautions to reduce the risk of stealing and the procedure for apprehending a person seen stealing.

results.title: Shrek [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Adamson, Vicky Jenson, Aron Warner, Jeffrey Katzenberg, John H. Williams and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: Once upon a time in a land far, far away, and so begins this animated fantasy. Set in a fantastical kingdom inhabited by fairy tale creatures, the story finds the enchanted princess, Fiona (Cameron Diaz) locked away in a tower guarded by a dragon; a scheming Lord Farquaard (John Lithgow) who wants to marry the princess so he can become King; an unlikely hero, the lovable ogre Shrek (Mike Myers) and his sidekick, Donkey (Eddie Murphy), who are sent by Farquaard to rescue the princess and bring her back to be his bride. Children will enjoy the tale for what it is - a lively romp, while adults will enjoy the many intertextual references to numerous other fairy tales.

results.title: He knows some things
results.brief_description: The use of colour and fluid animation suggests the innocence and carefree nature of childhood while the accompanying voice over suggests that childhood is much more complex. The work demonstrates skilfull use of rotoscoping techniques.
